document_data.name: Al-Yabki Mountains
document_data.mainbody: '''Al-Yabki Mountains''', also called the '''Mountains of the Tears''' or simply the '''Mountains of Tears''', were located in the [[Pearl Cities]] region of [[Zakhara|west Zakhara]].
document_data.Geography: The mountain range ran for several hundred miles from the northwest near [[Tajar]] to the southeast near [[Jumlat]] and [[Gana]].
document_data.Notable Features:
Several rivers—including  [[Al-Nuhas River|Al-Nuhas]], [[Al-Fatir River|Al-Fatir]], and [[Al-Sabiya River|Al-Sabiya]]—originated within the heights of Al-Yabki Mountains.

The peaks of Al-Yabki Mountains were composed of red sandstone.

The nearby city of [[Gana]] supported a rookery held within the mountains that contained five highly trained [[Zakharan roc]]s and rider.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The mountains were home to a wise [[genie]] named [[Baran al-Amin al-Jinn]] who acted as a ''[[Midani dictionary|qadi]]'' for the region.
